title: Police: 1 Dead, 7 Injured in North Minneapolis Gang-Related Shooting
content:
The Minneapolis Police Department now says eight people were shot in north Minneapolis on Wednesday night.
A 20-year-old man died at the scene, two people are in critical condition and five others were hospitalized with injuries. The victims range in age between 20 and 27 years old; five are men and three are women.
The shooting was reported at 8:50 p.m. Wednesday near 16th Avenue North and Newton Avenue North.
Police say the shooting appears to be gang-related, and they believe both sides fired shots at each other. More than four dozen shell casings were found at the scene, and two handguns were recovered, according to police.
Inspector Mike Kjos said at least 20 officers were called to the scene, and six investigators are looking into the shooting. Several blocks in the area were closed Wednesday night during the initial response.
Anyone with information is asked to call 612-692-8477.
